column2: MONTANA DMV TEST
column4: Montana

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text

column2: 1. Many crashes are caused by:
column4: frequently checking mirrors and blind spot.
column8: maintaining a 4-second following distance between your vehicle and any vehicle in front of you.

column2: 2. If you see a “lane closed ahead” sign you should:
column4: make a U-turn. You are on the wrong side of the road.
column6: speed to the end of the closed lane and try to get into the other lane.
column8: merge into the correct lane when it is safe.

column2: 3. This sign indicates:
column4: a cross road.

column2: 4. A broken yellow line alongside a solid yellow line means:
column4: Passing is not permitted in either direction
column6: Passing is permitted on the side of the broken yellow line
column8: Passing on the right is permitted in either direction
column10: Passing is permitted on the side of the solid yellow line

column2: 5. If you are blinded by headlights on an approaching vehicle, you should:
column4: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.
column6: use the road edge as a guide until the approaching vehicle passes by.
column8: move your eyes to the right.

column2: 6. An inattentive driver:
column4: carries on an eye-contact conversation with a passenger while driving.
column6: gazes at objects off the roadway while driving.

column2: 7. You go with a group of friends to a social event, and you plan to have a few drinks. You should:
column4: arrange to ride home with a friend who does not drink.
column6: make alcohol the focus of the event.
column8: stop drinking several minutes before you intend to leave.
column10: avoid alternating between drinks with alcohol and drinks without any alcohol.

column2: 8. If another car has stopped in an adjacent lane in the same direction of travel, you should:
column4: pass the car on the left.
column6: be careful in case the other vehicle has stopped for a pedestrian.
column8: speed up and pass the vehicle on the right.
column10: tap your horn to let the other driver know you are passing.

column2: 9. Drivers may pass another vehicle if the line dividing two lanes is a ________ line.
column4: broken white

column2: 10. This road sign means:
column4: Sharp right turn ahead

column2: 11. This road sign means:
column4: Intersection ahead

column2: 12. You hear a siren close by but can not see where the emergency vehicle is. What do you do?
column4: Stop immediately and activate your emergency flashers.
column6: Stop only if you are sure that the vehicle is headed toward you in the opposite lane.
column8: Pull over to the right side of the road and stop until you are sure the emergency vehicle is not headed toward you.
column10: Keep driving until you are sure the emergency vehicle is headed toward you.

column2: 13. When you drive into the street from any driveway you:
column4: must honk the horn so approaching vehicles and pedestrians can allow you room.
column6: must stop and proceed only when there are no pedestrians or vehicles approaching.
column8: can disregard pedestrians if there is no sidewalk.
column10: must drive slowly so approaching vehicles and pedestrians can get out of your way.

column2: 14. Emotions can affect your driving by:
column4: decreasing your chances of an accident.
column6: making you more aware of others around you.
column8: causing you to go to sleep at the wheel.
column10: lessening your concentration on the driving task.

column2: 15. This sign means:
column4: divided highway ahead.

column2: 16. This sign means:
column4: 360 degree turn ahead.

column2: 17. You are stopped behind other vehicles waiting at a stop sign. When the intersection is clear:
column4: you may follow the vehicle ahead without stopping again.
column6: you must stop again at the stop sign.
column8: you may proceed with caution through the intersection without stopping if there is no other traffic.
column10: you must proceed through the intersection without stopping again.

column2: 18. Drivers should always signal when:
column4: changing lanes.
column6: pulling into traffic from a parking area or alley.
column8: pulling out of a parking space.

column2: 19. This road sign means:
column4: Divided highway ends

column2: 20. The octagonal shape is used:
column4: for stop signs and railroad advance warning signs.
column8: to warn drivers of existing or possible hazards on roadways.

column2: 21. An edge line that angles toward the center of the road indicates that:
column4: you must turn right.

column2: 22. A pedestrian in the crosswalk when the 'DON’T WALK' signal begins flashing must:
column4: yield to other pedestrians.
column10: go back and wait the “WALK” light

column2: 23. When parking uphill on a road with a curb, turn the front wheels:
column4: away from the curb.

column2: 24. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: slow down and keep well to the left.
column6: increase their speed and keep well to the right.
column10: slow down and keep well to the right.

column2: 25. To avoid being in a truck driver’s blind spot, you should:
column4: never pass the truck and put your headlights on.
column6: avoid driving on either side of the truck and don’t tailgate.

column2: 26. This road sign means:
column4: Left turns are not allowed where this sign is displayed.
column8: Drivers cannot make a complete turn to go in the opposite direction.
column10: Vehicles turning left must make a U-turn.

column2: 27. You have been involved in a minor traffic collision with a parked vehicle and you can't find the owner. You must:
column4: leave a note on the vehicle and report the accident with no delay.
column6: call your insurance company within 14 days.
column8: wait for the owner to return.

column2: 28. This road sign means:
column4: Right turn on red light permitted
column10: All traffic must turn right at next intersection

column2: 29. How can you prevent fatigue on a long trip?
column4: Plan to drive long trips with a companion.
column8: Schedule regular stops for every couple of hours.

column2: 30. A steady yellow light means that a ______ light will soon appear.
column4: steady red

column2: 31. At night, it is hardest to see:
column4: road signs.

column2: 32. If an intersection has crosswalk lines but no STOP line, where must you stop for a red light?
column4: Before the stop line.

column2: 33. This road sign means:
column4: You must come to a complete stop
column6: Drive with caution and be ready to stop

column2: 31. At night, it is hardest to see:
column4: road signs.

column2: 32. If an intersection has crosswalk lines but no STOP line, where must you stop for a red light?
column4: Before the stop line.

column2: 33. This road sign means:
column4: You must come to a complete stop
column6: Drive with caution and be ready to stop
